body:
Is there any reason to implement half normal if it can be implemented using the transforms in the user code? 

Don't know how often this one appears in practical applications, but in general I think it's a better idea to limit the package to most important distributions, and have a large enough set of transforms to implement the remaining ones as almost one liners. I'm afraid that having a ton of different distributions implemented like this one will slow you guys down, as you will have to maintain all of them.
